intro: Linanthus nuttallii var. floribundus, commonly known as the showy linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and open grasslands. Its slender, branching stems and showy inflorescences make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
